title: Small Onion Sambar | Ulli sambar
content:
Side dish: Small onion sambar Servings: 4 Duration: 30 minutes Sambar is a Savory Lentils Soup or stew made with Red Gram, freshly chopped veggies and by adding Homemade Sambar Powder. Today I am sharing the easiest sambar recipe with shallots or small onion. It serves as a side dish for South Indian Breakfasts such as Poori, Dosa, Idly and at lunch, you can serve with rice or Chapathi. This Sambar is flavorful and delicious ðŸ˜‹ I hope you will try and enjoy it! Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Small onions - 250 grams
  • Split red gram/ toor dal/ Kandi Pappu - cooked - 80 grams
  • sambar powderÂ (homemade) - 1 tbsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Coconut oil - 1 tbsp
  • Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp - chopped
  • Tamarind pulp - 1 teaspoon - soaked in 2tbsp water
  • Salt- 1 tsp
  • Hing / asafoetida - 1/4 tsp
  • Mustard seeds - 1 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1 tsp
  • Curry leaves - 8
  • Water - 100 ml to cook onions
  • Water - 320 ml to make sambar
Procedure: How to cook toor dal?
  • In a bowl add red gram and wash twice, drain the water then transfer dal to a pressure cooker, add turmeric powder (1/2 tsp ) and water ( 200 ml )
  • Cook for 3 whistles and turn off the heat. When the pressure released, open the lid and saute with ladle then transfer to a bowl. Keep it aside
Process of making sambar:
  • On a medium heated skillet, add oil
  • When it's hot add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves
  • Saute half a minute or till they splutter, then add shallots/ small onions
  • Saute 5 minutes then add hing, turmeric powder, and salt
  • Saute and add water 100 ml, cover with the lid and cook for 10 mins
  • Then add cooked dal, tamarind water, jaggery, sambar powder, saute a minute
  • Next, add 320 ml water and combine well
  • Cover with lid and cook sambar for 10 more minutes
  • When sambar cooked well, turn off the heat and add coriander leaves
  • Combine well and serve with rice and papad :-)
